general.label: About
general.comment:
• AJAX-ZOOM is a multipurpose library for displaying (high resolution) images and 360°/3D spins.
    This Magento module integrates only one particular implementation (example) from AJAX-ZOOM library into Magento.
    In raw form this example can be found here: http://www.ajax-zoom.com/examples/example32_responsive.php
    There you will also find some subtle details about the options which you can configure below.
    The options below mainly refer to this one implementation / example.

    However AJAX-ZOOM has many other options which can be set manually in /js/axzoom/axZm/zoomConfigCustom.inc.php after
    elseif ($_GET['example'] == 'mouseOverExtension360') for 360° views and
    elseif ($_GET['example'] == 'mouseOverExtension') for regular images views
    or if you do not want to edit PHP files - most of the options can be also set in these formfields as JS plain object:
    1. azOptions - for 2D zoom
    2. azOptions360 - for 360/3D zoom
  • Depending on the template used you might need to adjust especially these two options:
    1. zoomWidth - width of the mouseover flyout window
    2. zoomHeight - height of the mouseover flyout window
    If you will be not able to adjust these options on your own please ask for support
  • Other useful / most common options are marked green with this symbol:

lic.label: License
lic.comment: Ask for support   Buy a license

position.label: position
position.comment: Position of the flyout zoom window, possible values: 'inside', 'top', 'right', 'bottom', 'left'

posAutoInside.label: posAutoInside
posAutoInside.comment: applies when width (left, right) or height (top, bottom) of zoom window are less than this px value (zoomWidth || zoomHeight are set to auto); if zoomWidth || zoomHeight are fixed, applies when zoom window is out of page border

posInsideArea.label: posInsideArea
posInsideArea.comment: When "posAutoInside" is enabled and inner zoom fires or "position" option is set to 'inside' right away - there is no lens. However you will notice that the reaction to mouse movements occure somewhere in the middle of the image; at the edges mostly nothing happens in simmilar scripts. With this option you can adjust how far from the edge mouse movements should be captured. The range is between 0 and 0.5;

touchScroll.label: touchScroll
touchScroll.comment: If width of the mouseover zoom container is more than 80% (0.8) of the widnow width, than for touch devises the inner zoom will be not triggered and the user can scroll down. Click for open AJAX-ZOOM remains. Set this value to 0 if you want to enable the slider for touch devices only.

noMouseOverZoom.label: noMouseOverZoom
noMouseOverZoom.comment: Disable mouseover zoom completly for touch and none touch devices. If you want to disable it only for touch devices, set "touchScroll" option above to 0

autoFlip.label: autoFlip
autoFlip.comment: Flip right to left and bottom to top if less than int px value or false to disable

biggestSpace.label: biggestSpace
biggestSpace.comment: Overrides position option and instantly chooses the direction, disables autoFlip; playes nicely when zoomWidth and zoomHeight are set to 'auto'

zoomFullSpace.label: zoomFullSpace
zoomFullSpace.comment: Uses full screen height (does not align to the map / disables adjustY) if position is right or left || uses full screen width (does not align to the map / disables adjustX) if position is top or bottom

zoomWidth.label: zoomWidth
zoomWidth.comment: Width of the zoom window e.g. 540 or 'auto' or jQuery selector|correction value, e.g. '#refWidthTest|+20'; so if you want to have a width of the zoom window same as for example a responsive container to the right (so it is fully covered) and max possible height, then define the id of this container to the right, e.g. 'myArticleData', set "zoomWidth" to '#myArticleData|+10' and "zoomHeight" to 'auto'. New in Ver. b4: if you have a three column design and want to cover both containers to the right, then just define both containers in the jQuery selector, e.g. '.pb-center-column,.pb-right-column|+20'; the margin between the containers is not taken into account but you can adjust the result with the second value after vertical bar.

zoomHeight.label: zoomHeight
zoomHeight.comment: Height of the zoom window e.g. 375, or 'auto' or jQuery selector|correction value, e.g. '#refWidthTest|+20'; if your selector matches more than one element, e.g. '.pb-center-column,.pb-right-column|+20', then the highest value will be choosen. This is different from the multiple selector in "zoomWidth", where the values are added.

autoMargin.label: autoMargin
autoMargin.comment: If zoomWidth or zoomHeight are set to 'auto', the margin to the edge of the screen

adjustX.label: adjustX
adjustX.comment: Horizontal margin of the zoom window

adjustY.label: adjustY
adjustY.comment: Vertical margin of the zoom window

lensStyle.label: lensStyle
lensStyle.comment: Quickly override css of the lens

lensClass.label: lensClass
lensClass.comment: Set css class for the lens

zoomAreaBorderWidth.label: zoomAreaBorderWidth
zoomAreaBorderWidth.comment: Border thickness of the zoom window

galleryFade.label: galleryFade
galleryFade.comment: Speed of inner fade or false

shutterSpeed.label: shutterSpeed
shutterSpeed.comment: Speed of shutter fadein or false; applies only if image proportions are different from container

showFade.label: showFade
showFade.comment: Speed of fade in for mouse over

hideFade.label: hideFade
hideFade.comment: Speed of fade out for mouse over

flyOutSpeed.label: flyOutSpeed
flyOutSpeed.comment: Speed for flyout or false to disable

flyBackSpeed.label: flyBackSpeed
flyBackSpeed.comment: Speed for fly back or false to disable

flyBackTransition.label: flyBackTransition
flyBackTransition.comment: Transition type of the fly back

autoScroll.label: autoScroll
autoScroll.comment: Scroll page when clicked on the thumb and the mouse over preview image is not fully visible

smoothMove.label: smoothMove
smoothMove.comment: Integer bigger than 1 indicates smoother movements; set 0 to disable

tint.label: tint
tint.comment: Color value around the lens or false

tintOpacity.label: tintOpacity
tintOpacity.comment: Opacity of the area around the lens when "tint" option is set to some color value

tintFilter.label: tintFilter
tintFilter.comment: Apply filter to the image, e.g. "blur", "grayscale", "sepia", "invert", "saturate"; see also .axZm_mouseOverEffect>img CSS

tintLensBack.label: tintLensBack
tintLensBack.comment: Show background image in the lens

showTitle.label: showTitle
showTitle.comment: Enable / disable title on zoom window

titlePosition.label: titlePosition
titlePosition.comment: Position of the title, top or bottom

cursorPositionX.label: cursorPositionX
cursorPositionX.comment: Cursor over lens horizontal offset, 0.5 is middle

cursorPositionY.label: cursorPositionY
cursorPositionY.comment: Cursor over lens vertical offset, 0.5 is middle

touchClickAbort.label: touchClickAbort
touchClickAbort.comment: Time in ms after which click is aborted without touch movement and mousehover is initialized

loadingMessage.label: loadingMessage
loadingMessage.comment: Loading message, not needed, can be just the spinner - see below

loadingOpacity.label: loadingOpacity
loadingOpacity.comment: Opacity of the loading container (the transparent background is set via png image on default, see css class)

zoomHintEnable.label: zoomHintEnable
zoomHintEnable.comment: Enable zoom icon which disappears on mouse hover; css class: .axZm_mouseOverZoomHint; If you want to change the position or the icon simply change the css class;

zoomHintText.label: zoomHintText
zoomHintText.comment: Text which will be appended next to the icon enabled by "zoomHintEnable"

zoomMsgHover.label: zoomMsgHover
zoomMsgHover.comment: Message which can appear under the mouse over zoom, css class: .axZm_mouseOverZoomMsg

zoomMsgClick.label: zoomMsgClick
zoomMsgClick.comment: Message which can appear under the mouse over zoom when the mouse enters it.

slideInTime.label: slideInTime
slideInTime.comment: Slide in time if "noMouseOverZoom" is enabled or "touchScroll" option enables for touch devices

slideInEasingCSS3.label: slideInEasingCSS3
slideInEasingCSS3.comment: jQuery equivalent of easing or own function (string), e.g. "cubic-bezier(0.21,0.51,0.4,2.02)", see also cubic-bezier.com

slideInEasing.label: slideInEasing
slideInEasing.comment: jQuery easing function for sliding in (fallback if CSS3 animation is not supported)

slideInScale.label: slideInScale
slideInScale.comment: Scale initial size (goes to 1.0 while animation)

slideOutDest.label: slideOutDest
slideOutDest.comment: Target slideout position, possible values: 1, 2 or 3

spinner.label: spinner
spinner.comment: Use ajax loading spinner without gif files etc

spinnerParam.label: spinnerParam
spinnerParam.comment: Spinner options, for more info see: http://fgnass.github.com/spin.js/

disableAllMsg.label: disableAllMsg
disableAllMsg.comment: AJAX-ZOOM produces some notifications within the player telling that image tiles or other files are generating and returns the result. This happens only when an image or 360 images are opened for the first time. This is also the reason why preloading is slow at first. With this switch you can disable these notifications in the front office.

galleryDivID.label: galleryDivID
galleryDivID.comment: DIV (container) id of the gallery, set to false to disable gallery

galleryPosition.label: galleryPosition
galleryPosition.comment: Position of the gallery in the template, possible values: "top", "right", "bottom", "left"; "left" and "right" will instantly change the gallery to vertical!

hideGalleryOneImage.label: hideGalleryOneImage
hideGalleryOneImage.comment: Instantly hide gallery if there is only one image or one 360/3D

hideGalleryAddClass.label: hideGalleryAddClass
hideGalleryAddClass.comment: This option is mainly for the layout with vertical gallery which is located next (left or right) to mouseover area. The most solid css layout for vertical gallery is when "divID" is wrapped by a div which has a left or right margin. This margin corresponds to vertical gallery width + some space inbetween. So if "hideGalleryOneImage" option is activated and there is only one image, only one 360 or no images / 360's at all, then the container represented by "galleryDivID" option is hidden and there is more space which can be filled. To do that we simply add a css class with margin 0 to the parent of "divID" overriding the left or right margin which is not needed for the gallery. You can change the "hideGalleryAddClass" to your own class name or set it to false to prevent this action.

galleryHover.label: galleryHover

galleryAxZmThumbSlider.label: galleryAxZmThumbSlider
galleryAxZmThumbSlider.comment: Use $.axZmThumbSlider on gallery thumbnails or not

galleryAxZmThumbSliderParam.label: galleryAxZmThumbSliderParam
galleryAxZmThumbSliderParam.comment:
Attention: you are editing JavaScript object! Errors will lead to AJAX-ZOOM not working properly.

$.axZmThumbSlider parametrs if "galleryAxZmThumbSlider" is enabled; for full list of options see under: http://www.ajax-zoom.com/axZm/extensions/axZmThumbSlider/

galleryAxZmThumbSliderParam_vertical.label: galleryAxZmThumbSliderParam_vertical
galleryAxZmThumbSliderParam_vertical.comment:
Attention: you are editing JavaScript object! Errors will lead to AJAX-ZOOM not working properly.

$.axZmThumbSlider parametrs if "galleryAxZmThumbSlider" is enabled; for full list of options see under: http://www.ajax-zoom.com/axZm/extensions/axZmThumbSlider/

thumbRetina.label: thumbRetina
thumbRetina.comment: Double resolution of the thumb image

qualityThumb.label: qualityThumb
qualityThumb.comment: Jpeg quality of the gallery thumbs

quality.label: quality
quality.comment: Jpeg quality of the preview image

qualityZoom.label: qualityZoom
qualityZoom.comment: Jpeg quality of the zoom image shown in the flyout window

firstImageToLoad.label: firstImageToLoad
firstImageToLoad.comment: Image from "images" option which should be loaded at first; see also "images360firstToLoad" option below

images360firstToLoad.label: images360firstToLoad
images360firstToLoad.comment: In case present load 360 from "images360" first and not an image from "images"

images360Thumb.label: images360Thumb
images360Thumb.comment: Show first image of the spin as thumb

images360Overlay.label: images360Overlay
images360Overlay.comment: Add a div with class "spinOverlImg" or "spinOverl" over the gallery thumb. On default it has a 360 icon as background.

images360Preview.label: images360Preview
images360Preview.comment: Normally plain images are opened in some kind of lightbox or fullscreen; By setting this option to true the 360's will load into "divID" at first and can be expanded to fullscreen.

images360PreviewResponsive.label: images360PreviewResponsive
images360PreviewResponsive.comment: This option is set to true for convinience reasons; In case your "divID" has fixed width and height, set $zoom['config']['picDim'] option in '/axZm/zoomConfigCustom.inc.php' after elseif ($_GET['example'] == 'mouseOverExtension360')

images360examplePreview.label: images360examplePreview
images360examplePreview.comment: In case "images360Preview" is set to true, the value of this parameter will be sent to AJAX-ZOOM as "options set" (example=mouseOverExtension360)

zoomMsg360.label: zoomMsg360
zoomMsg360.comment: Message displayed under mouse over zoom when 360 is loaded, e.g. "Drag to spin 360, scroll to zoom"; can be Javascript object e.g. {"en": "text english...", "de": "text german...", "fr":"text french..."}

zoomMsg360_touch.label: zoomMsg360_touch
zoomMsg360_touch.comment: Message displayed under mouse over zoom when 360 is loaded on touch devices, default: 'Drag to spin 360°, pinch to zoom in and out'. Can be Javascript object e.g. {"en": "text english...", "de": "text german...", "fr":"text french..."}

preloadMouseOverImages.label: preloadMouseOverImages
preloadMouseOverImages.comment: Preload all preview and mouseover images, possible values: false, true, 'oneByOne'

noImageAvailableClass.label: noImageAvailableClass
noImageAvailableClass.comment: In case there are no images in "images", nor there are any in "images360", a div with some image as background can be appended to the container and receive this options value as css class

width.label: width
width.comment: Width of the preview image or 'auto' (depending on parent container size - "divID", see above); this is also the value which will be passed to your AJAX-ZOOM imaging server to generate this image on-the-fly.

height.label: height
height.comment: Height of the preview image or 'auto' (depending on parent container size - "divID", see above); this is also the value which will be passed to your AJAX-ZOOM imaging server to generate this image on-the-fly.

responsive.label: responsive
responsive.comment: Set this to true for responsive layouts

oneSrcImg.label: oneSrcImg
oneSrcImg.comment: Use single image as "preview image" - the image which is hovered and the big "flyout image".

heightRatio.label: heightRatio
heightRatio.comment: If "responsive" option is enabled, "heightRatio" with instantly adjust the height of mouseover container depending on width calculated by the browser, e.g. 1.0 will always (only limited by "maxSizePrc" option) make height same as width; a value of 1.5 will make the preview like a portrait. You can also set "heightRatio" to 'auto'. In this case the height will be adjusted to cover available space instantly! Please note that when your images are not always same proportion, then the container will also change the size when the user switches to a different image.

heightMaxWidthRatio.label: heightMaxWidthRatio
heightMaxWidthRatio.comment: Similar as you would set max-width: someValue @media only screen condition you can define "heightRatio" depending on the width of the browser, e.g. ["960|0.8", "700|0.7"]

maxSizePrc.label: maxSizePrc
maxSizePrc.comment: Limit the height if "responsive" and "heightRatio" options are set. Setting "heightRatio" option may result in that the height of the mouseover zoom is bigger than window height and the image is not fully visible. To prevent this you can limit the calculated height with this "maxSizePrc" option. The value of 1.0 would limit the height to 100% of window height; a value of 0.8 to 80% of window height; you can also define two values, e.g. '1.0|-120' which would be window height minus 120px.

mouseOverZoomWidth.label: mouseOverZoomWidth
mouseOverZoomWidth.comment: Max width of the image that will be shown in the zoom window; this is the value which will be passed to your AJAX-ZOOM imaging server to generate this image on-the-fly. Please note that the size is limited by $zoom['config']['allowDynamicThumbsMaxSize'] which is can be set in '/axZm/zoomConfig.inc.php'. You can also specify a link to the image, see "images" option above. To set the width of the fly out window see "zoomWidth" under "mouseOverZoomParam".

mouseOverZoomHeight.label: mouseOverZoomHeight
mouseOverZoomHeight.comment: Max height of the image that will be shown in the zoom window; this is the value which will be passed to your AJAX-ZOOM imaging server to generate this image on-the-fly. Please note that the size is limited by $zoom['config']['allowDynamicThumbsMaxSize'] which is can be set in '/axZm/zoomConfig.inc.php'. You can also specify a link to the image, see "images" option above. To set the height of the fly out window see "zoomHeight" under "mouseOverZoomParam".

ajaxZoomOpenMode.label: ajaxZoomOpenMode
ajaxZoomOpenMode.comment: Determines how AJAX-ZOOM is opened when the user clicks on preview images / lens, possible values: 'fullscreen' (see also "fullScreenApi" option below), 'fancyboxFullscreen', 'fancybox', 'colorbox'; By editing $.mouseOverZoomInit you can extend the plugin to be used with different types of modal boxes to load AJAX-ZOOM into.

fancyBoxParam.label: fancyBoxParam
fancyBoxParam.comment: If fancybox is used in "ajaxZoomOpenMode" option, Fancybox options

colorBoxParam.label: colorBoxParam
colorBoxParam.comment: If colorbox is used in "ajaxZoomOpenMode" option, Colorbox options

example.label: example
example.comment: Configuration set which is passed to ajax-zoom when ajaxZoomOpenMode is 'fullscreen'

exampleFancyboxFullscreen.label: exampleFancyboxFullscreen
exampleFancyboxFullscreen.comment: Configuration set which is passed to ajax-zoom when ajaxZoomOpenMode is 'fancyboxFullscreen'

exampleFancybox.label: exampleFancybox
exampleFancybox.comment: Configuration set which is passed to ajax-zoom when ajaxZoomOpenMode is 'fancybox'

exampleColorbox.label: exampleColorbox
exampleColorbox.comment: Configuration set which is passed to ajax-zoom when ajaxZoomOpenMode is 'colorbox'

enforceFullScreenRes.label: enforceFullScreenRes
enforceFullScreenRes.comment: Enforce "ajaxZoomOpenMode" to be "fullscreen" if screen width is less than this value

prevNextArrows.label: prevNextArrows
prevNextArrows.comment: Put prev / next buttons over mouseover zoom. CSS: .axZm_mouseOverPrevNextArrows

disableScrollAnm.label: disableScrollAnm
disableScrollAnm.comment: Disable animation while zooming with AJAX-ZOOM

fullScreenApi.label: fullScreenApi
fullScreenApi.comment: Try to open AJAX-ZOOM at browsers fullscreen mode, possible on modern browsers except IE < 10 and mobile

axZmCallBacks.label: axZmCallBacks
axZmCallBacks.comment:
Attention: you are editing JavaScript object! Errors will lead to AJAX-ZOOM not working properly.

AJAX-ZOOM has several callbacks, http://www.ajax-zoom.com/index.php?cid=docs#onBeforeStart

azOptions.label: azOptions
azOptions.comment:
Attention: you are editing JavaScript object! Errors will lead to AJAX-ZOOM not working properly.

AJAX-ZOOM options can be set with JS when AJAX-ZOOM is inited. Normally you would be defining them in /axZm/zoomConfig.inc.php or /axZm/zoomConfigCustom.inc.php; this field is for convinience reasons. Example: {fullScreenCornerButton: false} - this would disable the button for fullscreen

azOptions360.label: azOptions360
azOptions360.comment:
Attention: you are editing JavaScript object! Errors will lead to AJAX-ZOOM not working properly.

Same as above but specifically for 360/3D

postMode.label: postMode
postMode.comment: Set AJAX-ZOOM to use POST instead of GET

enabled.label: enabled
enabled.comment: Experimental feature - enable Pinterest button. Pinterest allows to collect visual bookmarks in the form of images collected on the internet.

build.label: build
build.comment: Since images are changed the button needs to be repainted [...] In order to accomplish this the Pinterest API should be exposed to window object. This is done by setting data-pin-build attribute value in the script tag when pinterest JavaScript is included. <script data-pin-build="parsePinBtns" type="text/javascript" src="//assets.pinterest.com/js/pinit.js"></script> So if you do not have the data-pin-build, please add it to the script tag and if it is different from default ('parsePinBtns'), then change this "build" value. Otherwise the pinterest button will not work.

wrapClass.label: wrapClass
wrapClass.comment: This is the class of the container where the button will be put into. On default it is at bottom right. To place the button somewhere else you can either change the css of the default class or define a different class.

href.label: href
href.comment: href attribute before the button is build.

url.label: url
url.comment: Will be set instantly if null

media.label: media
media.comment: Will be set to current selected image if null

data.label: data
data.comment: Data attributes attached to the button before it is built. See pinterest API...

magentoAllImagesStart.label: magentoAllImages
magentoAllImagesStart.comment: Load all images independent on label (color), also from "Simple Products" which are bind to Configurable Product on start.

magentoNoImage.label: magentoNoImage
magentoNoImage.comment: Show magento no image available, if no AJAX-ZOOM no image available will be shown

magentoAdminThumb.label: magentoAdminThumb
magentoAdminThumb.comment: Replace normal images in admin area with dynamically generated thumbs of these images

displayOnlyForThisProductID.label: displayOnlyForThisProductID
displayOnlyForThisProductID.comment: CSV with product IDs for which AJAX-ZOOM will be only enabled. Leave blank to have it enabled for all products! This option can be usefull e.g. if you want to make A/B tests and enable AJAX-ZOOM only for certain products, e.g. 7,15 would enable AJAX-ZOOM only for products with ID 7 and 15
